alert.note: Alert for Napa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 1:10AM PST until March 11 at 11:30AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Francisco CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Napa River near St Helena affecting Napa County. For the Napa River...including St Helena...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Napa River near St Helena. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor flooding of low lying agricultural areas along river begins. Low lying rural residential areas immediately adjacent to the river and some secondary roads affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM PST Friday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 18.1 feet at 4 am this morning. It will then fall below flood stage at approximately 6 am this morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 03/09/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM PST.
